attributes.action: condemn the barbaric practice of tattooing domestic pets for purely cosmetic purposes, and that he will ensure that any person caught practicing these abhorrent acts will be deemed guilty of cruelty to animals by causing them to suffer pain, injury and trauma as defined in the Animal Welfare Act, 2006 and be subject to a fine of up to £20,000 and/or sent to prison.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
This new sick craze is practised in other countries, as highlighted in a national newspaper article on March 2nd 2009, but must be stopped in this country before it also becomes widespread. Pets are used as fashion accessories and the practice is sometimes referred to as “body enhancement.”
This is cruel and unnecessary and causes pain and suffering to the animals involved.
Often animals are not even given anaesthetic and have to endure terrible pain and trauma. They can even die of ink poisoning. This is a criminal act that must be stopped immediately.
